basic.title: MongoDB listens on a port different to default one
basic.caption: Using the default MongoDB port makes it too easy for potential attackers to locate and target your server.
message: Your server is listening on default port 27017. Please read this guide on how to change the listening port.
Your server is listening in a non-obvious port. Well done.

basic.title: Server only accepts connections from whitelisted hosts / networks
basic.caption: Best practice is to only listen to incoming connections whose originating IP belongs to the applications or systems that are intended to use the database. This protects your server from denial-of-service attacks and some other vulnerabilities that may be present on other services running on the same device.
message: Your server does accept connections from unauthorized hosts. Read this guide on how to create whitelists and block unauthorized hosts.
Your server does not accept connections from unauthorized hosts. Well done.

basic.title: MongoDB HTTP status interface is not accessible on port 28017
basic.caption: HTTP status interface should be disabled in production environments to prevent potential data exposure and vulnerability to attackers.
message: HTTP status interface is enabled. Please read this guide on how to disable MongoDB HTTP status interface.
HTTP status interface is disabled. Well done.

MongoDB is hiding its version number. Well done.
